title: Code Scalpel Response Configuration Schema
description: Configure MCP tool response output verbosity for token efficiency. Controls which metadata/tool data fields are included in responses - independent of tier.

version.description: Code Scalpel version this config is for

global.description: Global settings applied to all tools unless overridden

profile.description: Default output profile. minimal=~50-100 tokens, standard=~100-500, verbose=~500-2000, debug=unlimited

parsing.description: Deterministic parsing configuration - standardizes error handling across all entry points

mode.description: strict=fail on syntax errors, permissive=auto-sanitize with warnings

allow_merge_conflicts.description: If true, strip merge conflict markers. If false, fail with error.

allow_templates.description: If true, strip Jinja2/Django templates. If false, fail with error.

report_modifications.description: If true, include sanitization report in tool response

include_sanitization_details.description: Include what was modified during sanitization

include_suggestions.description: Include suggested fixes for common errors

profiles.description: Named output profiles with different verbosity levels

include.description: Envelope metadata fields to include in response

mode.description: fail_fast=crash on errors, auto_sanitize=fix and warn

common_exclusions.description: Fields to exclude from all tool responses at this profile level

tool_overrides.description: Per-tool configuration overrides. Keys are tool names. Use to exclude verbose metadata fields that consume tokens.

profile.description: Override the global profile for this tool

exclude_fields.description: Fields to always exclude from this tool's response (e.g., raw_ast, solver_statistics)

include_only.description: Whitelist mode: Only include these fields (overrides exclusions)

include_on_error.description: Fields to include only when tool returns an error (e.g., parser_warnings, sanitization_report)
